types.name: Affiliation
types.description: An association between a person and an institution for a specific contribution.

enumValues.name: AUTHOR
enumValues.description: Author of the work

enumValues.name: EDITOR
enumValues.description: Editor of the work

enumValues.name: TRANSLATOR
enumValues.description: Translator of the work

enumValues.name: PHOTOGRAPHER
enumValues.description: Photographer when named as the primary creator of, eg, a book of photographs

enumValues.name: ILLUSTRATOR
enumValues.description: Artist when named as the creator of artwork which illustrates a work

enumValues.name: MUSIC_EDITOR
enumValues.description: Person responsible for editing any piece of music referenced in the work

enumValues.name: FOREWORD_BY
enumValues.description: Author of foreword

enumValues.name: INTRODUCTION_BY
enumValues.description: Author of introduction

enumValues.name: AFTERWORD_BY
enumValues.description: Author of afterword

enumValues.name: PREFACE_BY
enumValues.description: Author of preface

enumValues.name: SOFTWARE_BY
enumValues.description: Writer of computer programs ancillary to the work

enumValues.name: RESEARCH_BY
enumValues.description: Person responsible for performing research on which the work is based

enumValues.name: CONTRIBUTIONS_BY
enumValues.description: Author of additional contributions to the work

enumValues.name: INDEXER
enumValues.description: Compiler of index

types.name: ContributorOrderBy
types.description: Field and order to use when sorting contributors list

types.name: Work
types.description: A written text that can be published

fields.name: fullTitle
fields.description: Concatenation of title and subtitle with punctuation mark

fields.name: title
fields.description: Main title of the work (excluding subtitle)

fields.name: subtitle
fields.description: Secondary title of the work (excluding main title)

fields.name: reference
fields.description: Internal reference code

fields.name: edition
fields.description: Edition number of the work (not applicable to chapters)

fields.name: doi
fields.description: Digital Object Identifier of the work as full URL. It must use the HTTPS scheme and the doi.org domain (e.g. https://doi.org/10.11647/obp.0001)

fields.name: lccn
fields.description: Library of Congress Control Number of the work (not applicable to chapters)

fields.name: oclc
fields.description: OCLC (WorldCat) Control Number of the work (not applicable to chapters)

fields.name: toc
fields.description: Table of contents of the work (not applicable to chapters)

fields.name: firstPage
fields.description: Page number on which the work begins (only applicable to chapters)

fields.name: lastPage
fields.description: Page number on which the work ends (only applicable to chapters)

fields.name: pageInterval
fields.description: Concatenation of first page and last page with dash (only applicable to chapters)

fields.name: contributions
fields.description: Get contributions linked to this work

fields.description: Research Organisation Registry identifier of the organisation as full URL. It must use the HTTPS scheme and the ror.org domain (e.g. https://ror.org/051z6e826)

types.name: Issue
types.description: A work published as a number in a periodical.

types.name: Isbn
types.description: 13-digit International Standard Book Number, with its parts separated by hyphens

types.name: Location
types.description: A location, such as a web shop or distribution platform, where a publication can be acquired or viewed.

types.name: ImprintOrderBy
types.description: Field and order to use when sorting imprints list

types.name: ReferenceOrderBy
types.description: Field and order to use when sorting references list

types.name: PublisherField
types.description: Field to use when sorting publishers list

types.name: Imprint
types.description: The brand under which a publisher issues works.

fields.name: works
fields.description: Get works linked to this imprint

args.name: limit
args.description: The number of items to return

args.name: offset
args.description: The number of items to skip

args.name: filter
args.description: A query string to search. This argument is a test, do not rely on it. At present it simply searches for case insensitive literals on full_title, doi, reference, short_abstract, long_abstract, and landing_page

args.name: order
args.description: The order in which to sort the results

args.name: workTypes
args.description: Specific types to filter by

args.name: workStatus
args.description: A specific status to filter by

types.name: Reference
types.description: A citation to a written text. References must always include the DOI of the cited work, the unstructured citation, or both.

fields.name: referenceId
fields.description: UUID of the reference.

fields.name: workId
fields.description: UUID of the citing work.

fields.name: referenceOrdinal
fields.description: Number used to order references within a work's bibliography.

fields.name: doi
fields.description: Digital Object Identifier of the cited work as full URL.

fields.name: unstructuredCitation
fields.description: Full reference text. When the DOI of the cited work is not known this field is required, and may be used in conjunction with other structured data to help identify the cited work.

fields.name: issn
fields.description: ISSN of a series.

fields.name: isbn
fields.description: Book ISBN, when the cited work is a book or a chapter.

fields.name: journalTitle
fields.description: Title of a journal, when the cited work is an article.

fields.name: articleTitle
fields.description: Journal article, conference paper, or book chapter title.

fields.name: seriesTitle
fields.description: Title of a book or conference series.

fields.name: volumeTitle
fields.description: Title of a book or conference proceeding.

fields.name: edition
fields.description: Book edition number.

fields.name: author
fields.description: First author of the cited work.

fields.name: volume
fields.description: Volume number of a journal or book set.

fields.name: issue
fields.description: Journal issue, when the cited work is an article.

fields.name: firstPage
fields.description: First page of the cited page range.

fields.name: componentNumber
fields.description: The chapter, section or part number, when the cited work is a component of a book.

fields.name: standardDesignator
fields.description: Standard identifier (e.g. "14064-1"), when the cited work is a standard.

fields.name: standardsBodyName
fields.description: Full name of the standards organisation (e.g. "International Organization for Standardization"), when the cited work is a standard.

fields.name: standardsBodyAcronym
fields.description: Acronym of the standards organisation (e.g. "ISO"), when the cited work is a standard.

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL of the cited work.

fields.name: publicationDate
fields.description: Publication date of the cited work. Day and month should be set to "01" when only the publication year is known.

fields.name: retrievalDate
fields.description: Date the cited work was accessed, when citing a website or online article.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Timestamp of the creation of this record within Thoth.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Timestamp of the last update to this record within Thoth.

fields.name: work
fields.description: The citing work.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description:
GraphQL type kind

The GraphQL specification defines a number of type kinds - the meta type of a type.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description:
## Scalar types

Scalar types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries. Strings, numbers, and booleans are the built in types, and while it's possible to define your own, it's relatively uncommon.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description:
## Object types

The most common type to be implemented by users. Objects have fields and can implement interfaces.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
## Interface types

Interface types are used to represent overlapping fields between multiple types, and can be queried for their concrete type.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description:
## Union types

Unions are similar to interfaces but can not contain any fields on their own.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description:
## Enum types

Like scalars, enum types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description:
## Input objects

Represents complex values provided in queries _into_ the system.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description:
## List types

Represent lists of other types. This library provides implementations for vectors and slices, but other Rust types can be extended to serve as GraphQL lists.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description:
## Non-null types

In GraphQL, nullable types are the default. By putting a `!` after a type, it becomes non-nullable.

types.name: Orcid
types.description: ORCID (Open Researcher and Contributor ID) identifier. Expressed as `^https:\/\/orcid\.org\/0000-000(1-[5-9]|2-[0-9]|3-[0-4])\d{3}-\d{3}[\dX]$`
